discussion.content:
A,C,D: https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=faq_data_import_wizard_how_many_records.htm&type=5 : You can import up to 50,000 records at a time with the Data Import Wizard.
&
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=faq_data_import_wizard_what_kind_objects.htm&type=5 : You can use the Data Import Wizard to import accounts, contacts, leads, solutions, campaign members, person accounts, and custom objects.
&
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=faq_import_general_who_in_my_org.htm&type=5 = IMPORTANT Salesforce has replaced the individual import wizards for accounts, contacts, and other objects with the Data Import Wizard. Individual import wizards open in small popup windows, while the Data Import Wizard opens in a full browser with dataimporter.app at the end of the URL. From Setup, enter Data Import Wizard in the Quick Find box, then select Data Import Wizard. The options you see depend on your permissions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true about Import wizard?

choices.C: When importing data file size cannot exceed 100 MB and each record in the file cannot be bigger than 400 KB
choices.A: You can import Accounts, contacts, leads, solutions and custom objects using the Import wizard
choices.D: Standard users can import up to 50000 account or contact records per session
choices.B: You can work with both records of data and metadata

comments.content: A virtual storage (for case records, e.g. support tickets) that can be used to group (using) criteria such as skill requirements (Level 1, 2, 3 support), product categories (Product specialists for different products), customer types (Business clients, general consumers, etc) or service levels (Platinum, Gold, Silver, etc, service contract) is called a: Case Queue

questions.question_text: A virtual storage that can be used to group on criteria such as skill requirements, product categories, customer types or service levels is called a:

How many External ID fields can you have per object?
External ID: When importing custom objects, solutions, or person accounts, you can use external IDs to prevent duplicate records from being created as a result of the import operation.

discussion.content:
You can designate up to 25 External ID fields per object. 
I think the question is Incorrect.Please Explain

Maximum number of 'External Ids' per object or entity. You can designate up to 25 External ID fields per object. External ID fields must be Custom text, number or email fields. External ID fields contain record IDs from systems outside Salesforce.

Yeap, I think it should be 25, refer this
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=000324871&language=en_US&type=1&mode=1
That is because not every users have the same access rights. so User A will see what is available/acessible to them compare to User B.
This question is a bit misleading since it doesn't whether both users share the same profile/PS.
Does one assume that the two users have different roles or profiles? What if both users had the same role and profile?

comments.content: If User A and B have the same profile, what happens when user B has a permission set allowing him to view a record A doesn't have access to? When A and B search for that record, only user B will be able to see it because of the permission set granting extra permissions.

questions.question_text: Will two different users get the same search results on searching for a common keyword?

discussion.content: Encrypted fields are encrypted with 128-bit master keys and use the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm. You can archive, delete, and import your master encryption key. To enable master encryption key management, contact Salesforce.

choices.A: Selecting "Enable Field Encryption" under Organization Wide Defaults

questions.question_text: You can enable field encryption by:
